channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Manhole cover is not at all on the man hole. It is an open void, 18th October
item.description:
There is no cover on the manhole/drain on the brook. It is just an open hole which is very dangerous and smells
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Everleigh Walk, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars running the first red light at this junction, 18th October
item.description:
I live in Harper close and use this road every day, cars constantly ignore or do not realise there are 2 sets of lights and yesterday this car drove very fast to the second set of lights, if traffic had been coming out from Oakwood station there would have been a serious accident. There should be a visible working camera there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chase Road, Cockfosters, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van no MOT, 18th October
item.description:
White Ford transit van reg. Y849 CNG left here for who knows how long, very clearly abandoned. MOT expired. In general this road seems to be used to dump cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Avenue, London

item.title: Human faeces in bag, 18th October
item.description:
Human poo dumped in bag next to Greenwich leaves clearing. On corner of Gerda and thaxted. In Lidl bag. Smells disgusting and attracting wildlife

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Thaxted Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Fake QR code added to Ringo parking sign, 18th October
item.description:
Fake QR codes have been stuck to the Ringo parking signs on Cedars Road. I believe these will direct people wishing to pay for parking to a scam site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedars Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Councillor Chris Kennedy & mayor of Hackney gloating, appraising themselves about saving the bath house community center. Chris Kennedy & the mayor of hackney enjoying themselves at a day out at the sauna, spar. Councillor Chris Kennedy & the mayor of the borough of Hackney really work hard in your community trying to make it better for residents. Chris Kennedy & the mayor of Hackney do nothing about antisocial behavior / criminal activity in the neighborhood but they have time for leisure. Work and pleasure at the same time. These elected people do not serve the community in the right way and funding for right things many residents struggling in the borough of Hackney But they find funding and time to support bath house from closure. This bath house does not serve the whole community only a small number of people. The councillor Chris Kennedy & the mayor of the borough of Hackney should open a community hall for young people to do things. Instead of young teenagers getting recruited into crime., 18th October
item.description:

item.title: Dead fox; health and sanitation risk; needs removing, 18th October
item.description:
A dead adult fox lying on a pile of building waste on a busy main road. Pavements frequently used by pedestrians. The body is a sanitation risk and needs removing and disposing of safely and properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58-60, Fortis Green, Muswell Hill, London

item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 18th October
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned over 2 yrs ago by departed tenant., 18th October
item.description:
3rd time. Ref. 8180037 Wednesday, 17 September This bicycle was abandoned by a departed tenant 2yrs ago. It has fallen over again and is a trip hazard once more. On the 10 Sept I forgot to meantion it also has flat tyres. 164 Cambridge St, Pimlico, London SW1V 4QE. Please dispose of it. 25th Sept 2024 ref: 6512298.
